title: KLM Outdoors New World Business Class
text:
18 August 2015 16:30 CET KLM Outdoors New World Business Class By Daily Guide 
Mr Axel Metselaar (right), Country Manager for Air France-KLM, pointing to some new on-flight dishes served by his company, as Mr Yves Palazot, Managing Director of Servair Ghana, looks on 
KLM Ghana has announced it is offering a promotional discount of USD777 to all customers purchasing tickets for the airline's World Business Class to destinations in Europe, the USA and Canada. 
In addition, loyal KLM customers enrolled in the Flying Blue loyalty program will receive 7770 bonus miles when flying during the period of the promotion. 
According to the airline's office in Accra, tickets must be purchased by September 7, 2015 and travel must be completed by November 30, this year. 
Explaining details of the promotion to the media in Accra recently, Axel Metselaar, Country Manager of Air France-KLM, indicated that the airline decided to introduce the promotion after KLM Royal Dutch Airlines started operating its Boeing 777-200 on a daily basis between Accra and Amsterdam, on 14 August, this year. 
He said a fully renovated cabin interior in the World Business and Economy Classes, a fully renewed in-flight entertainment system offering access to more than 150 movies and 200 TV shows in many local and foreign languages, the new Economy Class seats designed by Hella Jongerius, offer travelers more legroom and a whole new in-flight entertainment system. 
It features a larger nine-inch, HD-quality touch-screen, interactive 3D cards and a 'seat chat' app that allows travelers to communicate with passengers who are seated elsewhere in the cabin. 
'We are elated KLM's top management has determined to schedule this totally new onboard product on a daily basis for the Accra route. 
'We have introduced the Boeing 777-200 on our Accra services since April 2015. However, the aircraft with the new interior is only available three times per week till now. As two-thirds of KLM's Boeing 777-200 fleet has been refurbished, we can offer a consistent upgraded product on a daily basis. This once again underlines the importance Ghana plays in the KLM's worldwide network,' Axel Metselaar said. 
He added that by the end of 2015, a total of 15 Boeing 777-200 in KLM's fleet should be refurbished. 
In March 2013, KLM introduced this new World Business Class interior aboard its Boeing 777. Currently, 10 out of 15 aircraft of this type in KLM's fleet have been refurbished. The Amsterdam-Accra-Amsterdam route has been specially selected to have this new refitted product on a daily basis from August 17 and onwards. 
The 15 Boeing 777-200 will all be equipped with both new cabins by the end of 2015, according to the management. 
BY Samuel Boadi
